result.execSummary:
The defendant Renea Antoinette Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Renea Antoinette Perez in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE re: counsel.  DE waives counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  State states recs.  DE agrees and State moves to amend to Misd. Theft.  Court so amends.  DE pleads NC.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Amended to 943.20 Misd. Theft - NC
12 months probation concurrent to probation in 15CF384
Conditions of probation:
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office today or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Counseling/treatment per agent
DE to report to P&P by 3:30 today

Pre-trial conference at 03-24-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 04-05-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Renea Antoinette Perez in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Waived right to an attorney today.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
